perturbation.changed_text: (b) Payment of Promotion Fee. Exact, within ninety (90) days after the end of each Calendar Quarter of the Term, shall deliver to Pfizer a consolidated report in the form of and containing the information necessary to confirm the calculation of the Promotion Fee for such Calendar Quarter, together with the underlying spreadsheets with respect to such Calendar Quarter. The Promotion Fee due with respect to such Calendar Quarter and reflected on the consolidated report shall be remitted at the time such report is made.
perturbation.explanation: The change modifies the payment timeline, making it potentially inconsistent with standard business practices and potentially violating prompt payment laws in some jurisdictions. By extending the period for delivering the report to 90 days, it delays the payment and introduces a legal inconsistency.  Standard business practice requires payments to be made in a timely manner, usually within 30-60 days.

perturbation.original_text: Except to the extent expressly authorized by this Agreement or otherwise agreed in writing, the Parties agree that, for the term of this Agreement and for five (5) years thereafter, each Party (the "Receiving Party"), receiving any Confidential Information of the other Party (the "Disclosing Party") hereunder shall keep such Confidential Information confidential and shall not publish or otherwise disclose or use such Confidential Information for any purpose other than as provided for in this Agreement.
perturbation.changed_text: Except to the extent expressly authorized by this Agreement or otherwise agreed in writing, the Parties agree that, for the term of this Agreement and for one (1) year thereafter, each Party (the "Receiving Party"), receiving any Confidential Information of the other Party (the "Disclosing Party") hereunder shall keep such Confidential Information confidential and shall not publish or otherwise disclose or use such Confidential Information for any purpose other than as provided for in this Agreement.
perturbation.explanation: The original agreement stipulates a five-year confidentiality period post-termination. Changing this to one year introduces an inconsistency, potentially violating trade secret laws if five years is found to be commercially reasonable and necessary to protect the Disclosing Party's legitimate interests. Some jurisdictions may consider a one-year term inadequate for protecting sensitive information, leading to legal challenges.

perturbation.original_text: (i) Audit Right. Upon thirty (30) days prior written notice from a Party (the "Auditing Party"), the other Party (the "Audited Party") shall permit an independent certified public accounting firm of nationally recognized standing selected by the Auditing Party and reasonably acceptable to the Audited Party, to examine, at the Auditing Party's sole expense, the relevant books and records of the Audited Party and its Affiliates as may be reasonably necessary to verify the accuracy of the reports submitted by the Audited Party in accordance with Sections 3.4(d), 4.1(c) and 4.3(a) and the payment of Promotion Fees hereunder.
perturbation.changed_text: (i) Audit Right.
